subject: Re: [junit] Test order in a TestSuite random on JDK7
msgSnippet: Jaroslav, It should be very simple to create a custom runner: public class Ordered extends BlockJUnit4ClassRunner { // ... @Override protected
messageBody:
Jaroslav,

It should be very simple to create a custom runner:

public class Ordered extends BlockJUnit4ClassRunner {
// ...

@Override
protected List<FrameworkMethod> computeTestMethods() {
List<FrameworkMethod> methods = super.comptuteTestMethods();
Collections.sort(methods);
return methods;
}
}

And then @RunWith(Ordered.class) where it is important.

David Saff

<jaroslav.tulach@...> wrote:
> Hi,
> I am not sure if this was noticed (I have not seen any related post in this
> forum yet), but it seems that the order of execution of testXYZ methods in a
> TestCase subclass is random on JDK7.
>
> I believe randomness in a test execution is not good, it hurts
> reproducibility. Do you think JUnit should do something to mitigate the JDK7
> behavior?
